concise_definition: n. 幼兽, 小熊, 少年队员, 芝加哥小熊队

definitions.explanation_en: A young bear, especially one that is still dependent on its mother; used more broadly to refer to the young of other animals such as lions, wolves, or foxes.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指幼年的熊，尤其是仍依赖母熊的幼崽；也可泛指其他动物（如狮子、狼、狐狸）的幼崽。
definitions.example_en: The mother bear carefully watched over her cubs as they played near the stream.
definitions.example_cn: 母熊小心翼翼地注视着在溪边玩耍的幼崽。

definitions.explanation_en: A young boy, especially one who is a member of a youth organization such as the Cub Scouts, typically aged 7 to 10.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指年幼的男孩，尤指加入童子军预备组织（如幼童军）的7至10岁儿童。
definitions.example_en: The cubs went on a camping trip to learn survival skills and teamwork.
definitions.example_cn: 这些幼童军去露营，学习生存技能和团队合作。

definitions.explanation_en: A nickname for the Chicago Cubs, a professional baseball team based in Chicago, Illinois, known for its long history and passionate fan base.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指位于伊利诺伊州芝加哥的职业棒球队——芝加哥小熊队的昵称，该队历史悠久，拥有热情的球迷群体。
definitions.example_en: The cubs won the World Series in 2016 after a 108-year drought.
definitions.example_cn: 芝加哥小熊队在经历108年的冠军荒后，于2016年赢得了世界大赛冠军。

comparison.analysis: “Cub” 是 “cubs” 的单数形式，两者含义完全相同，仅在数量上区分。在语境中，使用复数形式 “cubs” 通常强调多个幼崽或多个少年队员，而单数 “cub” 更侧重个体。
“Puppy” (小狗) 专指幼犬，而 “cub” 可用于多种动物的幼崽，范围更广。此外，”cub“ 常用于比喻年幼的男孩，而 “puppy” 一般不用于人类，仅限动物。
“Child” (儿童) 是泛指所有未满青春期的人类孩子，语义更广泛且正式；而 “cub” 作为儿童的比喻用法，带有亲切、活泼甚至略带稚气的色彩，常用于特定组织（如幼童军）或文学语境中，更具形象性。
